availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas H. Fowler (Louisville, Kentucky, railroad agent)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, railroad agent. Pennsylvania native. Married to Matilda E. Vontagno Fowler in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on November 13, 1855. Father of Martha Fowler. Railroad agent in Louisville in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Louisville in 1860. Household hired an additional two enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860. Railroad agent in Louisville in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 4, p. 62.
